text: I don’t know if this is a weird request, but I would love it if the extension blocked HubSpot tracking. As a dev I don’t want my visits tracked on a clients website. Currently I use other tools to try to stop this, but it would be nice if it was built into a tool built for HubSpot.

very cool idea, don’t know why i never thought of it.

i mean ideally you should use the exclude by ip feature included in HS vs killing the tracking script using the extension killing which may not be as reliable. or could cause other issues(like it may kill the sprocket menu).

I could though include a button that brings you directly to the screen to exclude your IP address from tracking
<@UDPA7JFHA> what do you think of that solution?

That could be a solution. The issue I have is that my IP is dynamic. I am not sure how often it updates. Could there be a way to tell if your current IP matches one that is not currently being filtered?

only way I can see doing that would require the user to enter IP addresses into the extension to check against.

That could cause a user to mistakenly think they were not being tracked, if they went to a new portal that didn’t have the same IP’s in the exclude box
